title: Defining Absolute Minimum
text: The absolute minimum of f at $$x=c$$ is f(c) where $$f(c) \leq f(x)$$ for all $$x$$ in the domain of f.
speech: The absolute minimum of f at  x is equal to c  is f(c) where  f of c is less than or equal to, f of x  for all  x  in the domain of f.
pacedSpeech: The absolute minimum of f at   x is equal to c
is f(c) where   f of c is less than or equal to, f of x

title: Absolute Minimum
text: The graph attains an absolute minimum at $$x=3$$, because it is the lowest point on the domain of the function’s graph.
speech: The graph attains an absolute minimum at  x is equal to 3, , because it is the lowest point on the domain of the function’s graph.

, because it is the lowest point on the domain of the function’s graph.
